    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        chessPushed main method. Begins the game, calls for board initialization, scans and interprets turns, controls when to end the game and terminate the program.

      • initBoard

        public static piece[][] initBoard()
        Creates a chess board at starting position
        Returns:
        an 8x8 piece array with 32 black and white piece objects in starting position

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard​(piece[][] disBoard)
        Prints the current state of the board in accordance with the proper board format
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the 8x8 array board to be printed

      • doMove

        public static int doMove​(java.lang.String userInput,
                         char turn)
        Interprets move input string, checks for correct syntax and trivial errors, calls checkMove to determine move legality, executes legal moves
        Parameters:
        userInput - the inputted move by the user, ie e2 e4
        turn - white or black's turn
        Returns:
        -1 to indicate invalid move, 0 for resignation, 1 for the execution of a legal move, 2 for draw

      • getPiece

        public static piece getPiece​(piece[][] disBoard,
                             java.lang.String location)
        Converts chess location syntax to array coordinates and returns the piece at the relevant pointer.
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the chess board in its current state
        location - ie e4
        Returns:
        the piece pointed to at the specified location

      • copyBoard

        public static piece[][] copyBoard​(piece[][] disBoard)
        Creates a temporary copy of the chess board to test legality of certain moves
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the 8x8 piece array chess board in its current state to be copied
        Returns:
        a new 8x8 piece array with the same piece positions

      • inCheck

        public static java.util.ArrayList<piece> inCheck​(piece[][] disBoard,
                                                 char color,
                                                 int N,
                                                 int L)
        Checks if a specified location can be legally captured or accessed by a piece of the opposite color given
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the 8x8 piece array chess board in its current state
        color - the piece color of the king in check or the checking side
        N - row number of specified location
        L - column number of specified location
        Returns:
        the list of pieces of the opposite color that can move to N,L, empty would mean not in check or cannot be occupied

      • isCheckMate

        public static boolean isCheckMate​(piece[][] disBoard,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<piece> checkPieces,
                                  char color,
                                  int N,
                                  int L)
        Given location and color of king and list of attacking pieces, checks if legal moves exist
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the 8x8 piece array chess board in its current state
        checkPieces - the list of pieces putting the king in check
        color - the piece color of the king in check
        N - row number of specified location
        L - column number of specified location
        Returns:
        true if no legal moves exist and false if legal move was found

      • path

        public static boolean path​(int thisN,
                           int thisL,
                           int thatN,
                           int thatL)
        For Q, R, B, checks if there is an open corridor between current location and destination
        Parameters:
        thisN - current row of piece
        thisL - current column of piece
        thatN - row number of specified location
        thatL - column number of specified location
        Returns:
        true if the path is clear and false if any space in between is occupied

      • checkMove

        public static int checkMove​(piece[][] disBoard,
                            piece thisPiece,
                            java.lang.String thisLoc,
                            piece thatPiece,
                            java.lang.String thatLoc)
        Checks if given move is in accordance with the moveset of the given piece and sends indicators for special cases
        Parameters:
        disBoard - the 8x8 piece array chess board in its current state
        thisPiece - the piece to be moved
        thisLoc - the current location of the piece in chess string syntax
        thatPiece - the piece or space to be moved to
        thatLoc - the destination location of the piece in chess string syntax
        Returns:
        -1 for illegality, 1 for normal legal move, 2 to indicate a pawn double move, 3 for the movement of king or rook, 4 for pawn promotion
